TopicTitle: Make the parking brake on-screen toggle function mappable to a controller input

Articles.Content:
It's 2021 and I'm playing KSP 1.11.1 on Ubuntu 20.04 (I still love it )

But there still doesn't seem to be any way to map the on screen toggle brakes function to a controller input.  I know about using an action group as a workaround.  But, I'm playing through a new career and haven't unlocked action groups yet.  This seems like a significant and long outstanding oversight.

I can access the toggle brakes function from the default controls, keyboard and mouse.  But, since there's no way to map this function to a button on a controller, I have no choice but to take my hands off my controller of choice (i'm using a joystick) and click on an on screen button.

Too late and/or not worth the effort to implement this?

@SQUAD@Private Division
Would be a nice little "quality of life" thing.

I agree (and it used to be).  As a workaround, there is a very small mod which lets you double tap B to set the brakes:

https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/163950-19x-doubletapbrakes-2001-engage-parking-brakes-from-the-keyboard-19022020/&tab=comments#comment-3137096

You could change the b key to a controller button in the code (I think this is possible but never tried as pure keyboard and mouse man myself!) or assign the controller button to the B key in game/controller settings etc
